intro: Erica rachii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Erica rachii typically grows in well-drained, acidic soils and thrives in sunny, coastal environments. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
